moves.1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 g6 3. e3: a weak third move by White
moves.3... Bg7 4. Nf3 O-O 5. Bd3 d6 6. h3: to prevent Bg4, but wastes time
moves.6... Nbd7 7. b4: an unnecessary pawn move that wastes time and also creates tactical opportunites for Black's dark-square bishop
moves.7... Re8 8. Bb2 e5 9. dxe5 dxe5 10. e4: prevents the pawn fork, but now the light-square bishop is "bad"
moves.10... a5 11. a3 axb4 12. axb4 Rxa1: The rook exchange benefits black, who is ahead in development.
moves.17... Qc8 18. Kg2 Bh6: The bishop moves to a better diagonal.
moves.19. Bc3 f6: supports the e5 pawn, but opens up the a2-g8 diagonal for White's bishop
moves.20. Ra1: The a-file is of no use to anyone. All the action is on the kingside, where both kings are located.
moves.20... Nf8 21. Nb3 Bc6 22. c5 Bd7 23. Ng1: saves a tempo, in case of Bc4+
moves.24... exf4 25. g4: this allows the bishop sacrifice (not 25. ... Ng7? 26. Bxf6 +-)
moves.32... Ng5+ 33. Kf2 Ng3xe4+ 34. Kf1 Qh3+: The discovered check wins more material.
moves.36. Kd2 Nge4+ 37. Bxe4 Nxe4+ 38. Kc1 Qf1: White's king is getting cornered on the opposite side of the board.
moves.39. Kc2 Qc4+ 40. Kb1 Rd8 41. cxb6: White has 5 out of 6 pieces on the b-file and is in zugzwang.

gameName: White's pawn advance leads to Black's crushing attack
